options.text: The arrangement of ovules inside the ovary is called placentation

solution.text:
The stamen is the pollen making reproductive organ of the flower. It releases the pollen grain containing the male gametes from the anther. When a flower has a stamen without anther is called a staminode as it is sterile.

Ovary of the flower contains the ovule where the female gametophyte is developed. The ovules are arranged in a particular pattern within the ovary and this arrangement is called placentation. If the flower of a plant shows radial symmetry, it is called actinomorphic observed in datura, mustard. If the flower shows bilateral symmetry then it comes under zygomorphic group. Pea plant, gulmohar are included in it.
